Gaseous hydrogen and gaseous chlorine can react to form hydrogen chloride gas, as represented by the following equation.
<math alttext="H 2, gas, plus C l 2, gas, react to produce 2 H C l, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mtext mathvariant="italic">g</mtext></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Cl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mtext mathvariant="italic">g</mtext></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>HCl</mtext><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mtext mathvariant="italic">g</mtext></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>
content.question: The diagrams show particulate representations for samples of gaseous <math alttext="H 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="C l 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>Cl</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> separated by a barrier. After the barrier is removed, the gases react. Which of the following diagrams best represents the mixture if the reaction goes to completion?

choices.label: The figure shows a large box that contains four identical molecules. Each molecule is made up of one H atom and one C l atom.
The figure shows a large box that contains eight identical molecules. Each molecule is made up of one H atom and one C l atom.
The figure shows a large box that contains nine molecules. Eight molecules are made up of one H atom and one C l atom. One molecule is made up of two C l atoms.

The figure shows a large box that contains nine molecules. Seven molecules are made up of one H atom and one C l atom. One molecule is made up of two H atoms. One molecule is made up of two C l atoms.

content.answer: The figure shows a large box that contains nine molecules. Eight molecules are made up of one H atom and one C l atom. One molecule is made up of two C l atoms.
